meanings.definition: The state or quality of being finite.
meanings.sent1: The finitude of our time on Earth reminds us to cherish every moment.
meanings.sent2: The concept of finitude helps us understand the boundaries of our existence.
meanings.sent3: Even though the party had to end, its finitude made it all the more special.
meanings.sent4: The finitude of the marathon route challenged the runners to push their limits.
meanings.sent5: In the vast universe, the finitude of our planet is a humbling realization.

meanings.definition: The limitation or restriction of something to a certain amount or number.
meanings.sent1: The finitude of resources requires us to use them wisely.
meanings.sent2: We must acknowledge the finitude of our energy and allocate it effectively.
meanings.sent3: The finitude of toppings on the pizza left everyone wanting more.
meanings.sent4: The finitude of vacation days made planning the trip a strategic challenge.
meanings.sent5: The finitude of ingredients in the recipe forced us to get creative in the kitchen.
